title.value: Приспособляемость ходовых систем почвообрабатывающих агрегатов к почвенным условиям эксплуатации
Adaptability of undercarriage of soil-cultivating equipment to soil exploitation conditions
Adaptability of undercarriage of soil-cultivating equipment to soil exploitation conditions

journal.title: Agropanorama : scientific and technical journal for the agro-industrial complex workers

person.name: Shklyarevich, V.A., Belarus State Agrarian Technical Univ., Minsk (Belarus)
Vorobej, A.S., National Academy of Sciences, Minsk (Belarus). Scientific and Practical Center for Agriculture Mechanization

abstract.value: Existing constructions of the running systems of tractors and other self-propelled vehicles provide their high floatation without regard to the level of the impact on the soil, causing damage of the soil cover. The most popular tractors of 3 and 5 class used in the process of soil cultivation cause the highest soil compaction and lead to the increase of soil density. Therefore, parameters and arrangement of the running systems of soil-tilling aggregates, especially including tractors, should be under active consideration and management. The article presents the results of the research of a system 'person -- running system of the equipment – soil' and describes the correlations between them. Dependences connected with calculation of a measure of orderliness of a subsystem 'running system – soil' which can serve as an indicator according to adaptability of running systems of soil-cultivating units to soil conditions are offered. Constructions of engines of the soil-cultivating machines allowing increase the index of adaptability of soil-cultivating equipment to the soil exploitation conditions up to 1,5-2 times are suggested.
